chapterDescription: Practice explaining why a design choice is appropriate by comparing alternatives and acknowledging costs.

problems.question: A scenario of document collaboration backend surfaced this issue: the dominant concern is presenting one design option without alternatives with strict compliance scope. What is the best next move?
options: dismiss downsides as implementation details
avoid making a recommendation to reduce risk
offer generic tradeoff statements without specifics
compare at least two viable alternatives before choosing
problems.explanation: compare at least two viable alternatives before choosing is highest leverage because it mitigates presenting one design option and can be rolled out with measurable impact. Alternatives are weaker because they defer mitigation, rely on brittle assumptions, or increase operational risk.
problems.detailedExplanation: The right answer should reduce uncertainty and operational risk at the same time. In this system, compare at least two viable alternatives before choosing should be justified by expected risk reduction speed, blast-radius containment, and operational cost. A strong answer also names one residual risk and one post-rollout verification signal.

problems.detailedExplanation: This question is testing prioritization quality under constraints. A strong answer also names one residual risk and one post-rollout verification signal.
